mil3.3.5:0.3: Question on the Production and Development of Fabrications
mil3.3.5:1.2: “Venerable Nāgasena, are there any fabrications which are produced without development?”
mil3.3.5:1.3: “Your majesty, there are no fabrications which are produced without development. Fabrications are only produced with development.”
mil3.3.5:2.2: “What do you think, your majesty, was this house that you are sitting in produced without development?”
mil3.3.5:2.3: “There is nothing here, venerable sir, produced without development; it is produced only with development. These pieces of wood were in the forest, and this clay was in the ground, and thus this house was produced by the appropriate effort of women and men.”
mil3.3.5:2.4: “In the same way, your majesty, there are no fabrications which are produced without development. Fabrications are only produced with development.”
mil3.3.5:3.2: “Just as, your majesty, whatever seeds and plants thrown on the ground gradually attain to growth, development, and maturity, and would give flowers and fruit, no trees would be produced without development, and trees would only be produced with development.”
mil3.3.5:3.3: “In the same way, your majesty, there are no fabrications which are produced without development. Fabrications are only produced with development.”
mil3.3.5:4.2: “Just as, your majesty, a potter might take clay from the ground and make various bowls, those bowls are not produced without development, and bowls would only be produced with development.”
mil3.3.5:4.3: “In the same way, your majesty, there are no fabrications which are produced without development. Fabrications are only produced with development.”
mil3.3.5:5.2: “Just as if, your majesty, there were no sound-board for a lute, no parchment, no belly, no arm, no neck, no strings, no plectrum, and no suitable effort from a person, would sound be produced?”
mil3.3.5:5.4: “But if, your majesty, there were a sound-board for a lute, parchment, a belly, an arm, a neck, strings, a plectrum, and suitable effort from a person, would sound be produced?”
mil3.3.5:5.5: “Yes, it would be produced, venerable sir.”
mil3.3.5:5.6: “In the same way, your majesty, there are no fabrications which are produced without development. Fabrications are only produced with development.”
mil3.3.5:6.2: “Just as if, your majesty, there were no lower piece of wood, no twirling stick, no string for the twirling stick, no upper piece of wood, no bark, and no suitable effort from a person, would fire be produced?”
mil3.3.5:6.4: “But if, your majesty, there were a lower piece of wood, a twirling stick, string for the twirling stick, an upper piece of wood, bark, and suitable effort from a person, would fire be produced?”
mil3.3.5:6.5: “Yes, it would be produced, venerable sir.”
mil3.3.5:6.6: “In the same way, your majesty, there are no fabrications which are produced without development. Fabrications are only produced with development.”
mil3.3.5:7.2: “Just as if, your majesty, there were no crystal glass, no heat, and no cow-dung, would fire be produced?”
mil3.3.5:7.4: “But if, your majesty, there were a crystal glass, heat, and cow-dung, would fire be produced?”
mil3.3.5:7.5: “Yes, it would be produced, venerable sir.”
mil3.3.5:7.6: “In the same way, your majesty, there are no fabrications which are produced without development. Fabrications are only produced with development.”
mil3.3.5:8.2: “Just as if, your majesty, there were no mirror, no light, and no face, would an image be produced?”
mil3.3.5:8.4: “But if, your majesty, there were a mirror, light, and a face, would an image be produced?”
mil3.3.5:8.5: “Yes, it would be produced, venerable sir.”
mil3.3.5:8.6: “In the same way, your majesty, there are no fabrications which are produced without development. Fabrications are only produced with development.”
mil3.3.5:10.1: Question on the Production and Development of Fabrications fifth
